required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Does Respiratory Physiotherapy Allow for Earlier Withdrawal of Mechanical Ventilation in Respiratory Resuscitation Service?
clinical_study.official_title: Does Respiratory Physiotherapy Allow for Earlier Withdrawal of Mechanical Ventilation in Respiratory Resuscitation Service? Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Respiratory physiotherapy is not routinely prescribed in the resuscitation department and few studies deal with this subject, especially in respiratory resuscitation

clinical_study.why_stopped: The patient recruiting was stopped after 17 inclusions because of a reorganization of Intensive Care Units at the recruiting center.

primary_outcome.measure: Time between initiation of weaning protocol and extubation.

intervention.intervention_name: Study on patients with respiratory resuscitation
intervention.description: Patient intubated with mechanical ventilation in VS-AI mode, whose weaning is difficult

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient intubated with mechanical ventilation in VS-AI mode, whose weaning is difficult
- Major Patient over 18 years of age
- Patient affiliated to social security
Exclusion Criteria:
- Sedate
- With restrictive or tracheotomized syndrome
- With rib fractures
- Not able to benefit from physiotherapy within 3 hours after the start of the weaning protocol
- Refusal of patient or family
- Physiotherapy contraindications
- Patient under tutorship or curatorship
- Pregnant women
